data.title: Infinite Decks
data.solution:
n=int(input()) - 1

suit = ['hearts','spades','diamonds','clubs',
        'clubs','hearts','spades','diamonds',
        'diamonds','clubs','hearts','spades',
        'spades','diamonds','clubs','hearts'][n//13 % 16]

card = ['two', 'three', 'four', 'five', 'six', 
        'seven', 'eight', 'nine', 'ten', 'jack', 
        'queen', 'king', 'ace'][n%13]

print("%s of %s" % (card, suit))
data.statement:
Jack has infinitely many decks of cards. One day, he takes some of his decks and decides to arrange the cards <<from left to right>> in the following manner:

For the first deck, he takes the cards of the suit <<Hearts>> first, followed by the cards of <<Spades>>, <<Diamonds>> and <<Clubs>> respectively.
However, for the following decks, he decides to order the suits by <<circularly shifting>> the suits in the previous deck, i.e, the last suit in the previous deck becomes the first suit in the current deck, the first becomes second, and so on.

For example:
The order of suits in <<Deck 1>> will be [hearts, spades, diamonds, clubs].
The order of suits in <<Deck 2>> will be [clubs, hearts, spades, diamonds].
The order of suits in <<Deck 3>> will be [diamonds, clubs, hearts, spades].
The order of suits in <<Deck 4>> will be [spades, diamonds, clubs, hearts].
The order of suits in <<Deck 5>> will be [hearts, spades, diamonds, clubs].

The cards in each suit are arranged in the following order: 
<<2>> (two), <<3>> (three), <<4>> (four), <<5>> (five), <<6>> (six), <<7>> (seven), <<8>> (eight), <<9>> (nine), <<10>> (ten), <<J>> (jack), <<Q>> (queen), <<K>> (king), <<A>> (ace)

So, the first 13 cards would be:
<<two of hearts
three of hearts
four of hearts
five of hearts
six of hearts
seven of hearts
eight of hearts
nine of hearts
ten of hearts
jack of hearts
queen of hearts
king of hearts
ace of hearts>>

You are given a positive integer [[N]]. You are required to print the name of the [[N]]th card from the left after Jack arranges his cards.
data.inputDescription: <<Line 1:>> A positive integer [[N]], the position of the card whose name you have to print.
data.outputDescription: <<Line 1:>> The name of the card at the [[N]]th position.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Jack has infinitely many decks of cards. One day, he takes some of his decks and decides to arrange the cards from left to right in the following manner:

For the first deck, he takes the cards of the suit Hearts first, followed by the cards of Spades, Diamonds and Clubs respectively.
However, for the following decks, he decides to order the suits by circularly shifting the suits in the previous deck, i.e, the last suit in the previous deck becomes the first suit in the current deck, the first becomes second, and so on.

For example:
The order of suits in Deck 1 will be [hearts, spades, diamonds, clubs].
The order of suits in Deck 2 will be [clubs, hearts, spades, diamonds].
The order of suits in Deck 3 will be [diamonds, clubs, hearts, spades].
The order of suits in Deck 4 will be [spades, diamonds, clubs, hearts].
The order of suits in Deck 5 will be [hearts, spades, diamonds, clubs].

The cards in each suit are arranged in the following order:
2 (two), 3 (three), 4 (four), 5 (five), 6 (six), 7 (seven), 8 (eight), 9 (nine), 10 (ten), J (jack), Q (queen), K (king), A (ace)

So, the first 13 cards would be:
two of hearts
three of hearts
four of hearts
five of hearts
six of hearts
seven of hearts
eight of hearts
nine of hearts
ten of hearts
jack of hearts
queen of hearts
king of hearts
ace of hearts

You are given a positive integer N. You are required to print the name of the Nth card from the left after Jack arranges his cards.
Input
Line 1: A positive integer N, the position of the card whose name you have to print.
Output
Line 1: The name of the card at the Nth position.
Constraints
1 ≤ N ≤ 10⁹
Example
Input
53
Output
two of clubs
